column2: Project Role : Application Developer Project Role Description : Design, build and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements.  Must have skills : Microsoft Robotic Process Automation Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of full time education Summary :As an Application Developer with expertise in Microsoft Robotic Process Automation, you will be responsible for designing, building, and configuring applications to meet business process and application requirements. Your typical day will involve working with the latest technologies and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful solutions.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design, develop, and test Microsoft Robotic Process Automation (RPA) solutions to meet business requirements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize automation opportunities, and develop solutions that improve business processes. Configure and deploy RPA solutions using Microsoft Power Automate, Power Apps, and Azure. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams, and ensure that RPA solutions are scalable, maintainable, and secure. Stay updated with the latest advancements in RPA and related technologies, and integrate innovative approaches for sustained competitive advantage. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in Microsoft Robotic Process Automation (RPA) using Power Automate, Power Apps, and Azure. Good To Have Skills:Experience with other RPA tools such as UiPath, Automation Anywhere, or Blue Prism. Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies. Experience with programming languages such as C#, .NET, or Java. Solid grasp of database technologies such as SQL Server or Oracle. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Microsoft Robotic Process Automation (RPA) using Power Automate, Power Apps, and Azure. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, engineering, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful RPA solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of full time education

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Ability to develop and/or follow a project plan knowing the importance of setting and meeting milestone dates. Co-develop successive releases of controls software products in coordination with product champions. This includes the performance of complex design, maintenance, enhancement, testing, implementation, and support of these products. Experience in the design and development of controls based on physical layouts is expected. Software must be well structured, easy to understand and well documented. Develop software tools for the rapid deployment of controls software products for testing and applications environments. Ability to baseline existing systems, make needed improvements to stabilize/upgrade existing systems. This will require the ability to complete a complex review of requirements and limitations to determine that the systems perform optimally. Complete the quality process through the execution of module, subsystem, and system test procedures  including customer site commissioning when required. Ability to produce all documentation required as part of the development process including detailed design specifications, test documents and descriptions of operation. Complete estimates for modules under development and especially own work. Perform review of complex standards specifications and other documentation to determine engineering requirements. Perform presentations of complex technical findings and developments. Contribute to the development and maintenance of controls software standards. Train regional product champions in order to efficiently deploy the developed software products. 5% to 15% travel will be required Desired Candidate Profile   The CTO Global Controls Software Organization within responsible for delivering standard software and software controls products to support a wide range of conveyor and sortation solutions, warehouse automation, and distribution operations. As a Controls Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing standard controls software for PLC or other real time controller platforms. As part of a team within the controls software development organization, you will be responsible for delivering this software for our global customers, in partnership with our product management, application engineering and customer service groups. You must have a passion for excellence, the drive to complete tasks within the required time frame, the ability to work in a team environment and the technical skill to produce software of a high standard. Work, Health, Safety & Environment (WHS&E) Responsibilities Take care of your own health and safety as well as that of others including the implementation of risk control measures to prevent injuries or illnesses. Prevent pollution to the environment. Co-operate with policies, procedures and instructions including timely reporting of hazards, incidents and injuries via reporting process. Other responsibilities as outlined in WHS&E system documentation.   Other Responsibilities :- Comply with relevant statutory and legal requirements as required. Commit to and cooperate with quality management systems and processes. Key Relationships Other Software Development Groups. Development Project Management and Quality Assurance. Application Engineering. Mechatronics R&D. Product Management. Customer Service. Knowledge/Experience & Competence Req A minimum of 3 years PLC programming experience including current, hands-on experience with material handling / intralogistics systems (conveyor, stacker cranes, or pallet conveying systems). A minimum of 1 year experience in Siemens TIA coding is required. Must have a working understanding of design, layout and use of with industrial networks. Preferred experience in the following: Profinet, ProfiBus, and ASi, Experience designing and developing software using a higher level language such as C, C++, Visual Basic or Java. Experience in real time applications preferred. Experience in automated testing including scripting is beneficial. Experience in an agile development environment is beneficial. Experience in HMI/SCADA programming is beneficial (Iconics, Wonderware, RSView, WinCC or Citect). Bachelor or higher degree in electrical or mechatronics engineering, computer science or similar discipline. Honors level preferred

column2: ?     What we would like you to do      Creating the inventory of the processes that implies determining the automation potential of each process and filtering out those unfit for automation to narrow down the scope of work.     Conducting the opportunity assessment of the chosen processes during which the BA considers the process complexity, input type, etc.     In the Solution Design Phase, a BA creates the Process Design Document (PDD) with the help of which he transfers knowledge from the business unit to the development team.      BAs are also responsible for quality assurance; they also have to create test cases and scenarios.     During the Automate Phase, the BA monitors and keeps track of the changes that occur and initiates the Change Management process by evaluating the impact of the changes proposed.     In the Testing Phase, the BA coordinates all testing efforts and ensures the required sign-offs are obtained.     During Stabilize Improvement stages, BA compare KPI and compare the expected results to the actual ones.     Finally, yet importantly, goes the coordinating of the handover documents among the stakeholders and ensuring all the Change management procedures are followed       Our ideal candidate profile      The Business Analyst job is a hybrid role combining business acumen with IT experience. The job translates the products and services required and defined by the business in to components that can be understood by the developers. The main goal is to structure the requirements process and implementation resulting in automation that will meet business requirements and enhance the business operations.

column2: we are seeking talented UI Path Developers to join our dynamic team       As a UI Path Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing robotic process automation (RPA) solutions using UI Path platform     This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative automation projects and contribute to the digital transformation initiatives of our organization                   Key Responsibilities             Design, develop, and implement automation solutions using UI Path platform to streamline business processes and improve operational efficiency.         Collaborate closely with business analysts and stakeholders to understand automation requirements, identify automation opportunities, and define solution designs.         Develop automation workflows, including process mapping, screen scraping, data extraction, and integration with external systems.         Configure and customize UI Path robots to automate repetitive tasks, data entry, and data validation processes.         Implement error handling and exception handling mechanisms to ensure robustness and reliability of automation solutions.         Conduct unit testing and debugging of automation workflows to identify and resolve issues and ensure accuracy of results.         Deploy automation solutions to production environment and provide post-implementation support and troubleshooting as needed.         Document automation processes, technical designs, and solution architectures for knowledge sharing and future reference.         Stay updated on latest trends and best practices in RPA and automation technologies, and continuously improve skills and capabilities.             Qualifications             Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.         Proven experience as a UI Path Developer or RPA Developer, with hands-on experience in designing and implementing automation solutions using UI Path platform.         Strong understanding of RPA concepts, methodologies, and best practices.         Proficiency in UI Path Studio, including building automation workflows, configuring robots, and orchestrating automation processes.         Experience in integrating UI Path robots with external systems using APIs, web services, or other integration methods.         Knowledge of programming languages such as C#, VB.NET, or Java is a plus.         Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.         Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment and interact with stakeholders at all levels.

column2: Job Description  Power Automate Developer    Develop and implement custom solutions using Power Apps and Power Automate. Automate workflows and business processes. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical solutions. Stay up to date with the latest Power Apps and Power Automate features and trends. To automate Windows-based, browser-based, and terminal-based applications that are time-consuming or contain repetitive processes. Knowledge of approaches like UI, API, and database automations. Experience with Office 365 development utilizing PowerApps, Flow, and Power BI, Teams and SharePoint Online. Utilize problem-solving skills to understand client pain points and troubleshoot as challenges arise. Provide architecture, configuration, administration, and functional support to expand capabilities in Microsoft 365. Identify areas and processes where Microsoft 365, Office 365, and SharePoint can be better leveraged and facilitate process improvement. Responsible for estimating work content and achieving planned timelines. Proficient working in Agile project methodologies. Communicate proposed designs and progress on the work to customers, team leads, and team members. Support cross-functional project teams consisting of app development, IT operations, and information security.     Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities Required:  Extensive experience in the Microsoft Power Platform MS PowerApps, Flow, and Power BI Strong foundational knowledge of Office 365 platform including Exchange, Intune, Azure AD, and Azure ecosystem. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences. Strong business-to-technology translation skills are essential for identifying ways to apply solutions to help clients increase business value and performance. Exceptional verbal and written communication. Experience customizing SharePoint lists and disparate systems with PowerApps. Ability to create business processes and custom connectors with Microsoft Flow. Knowledge of PowerApps and Flow licensing plans and features included in different plans.    Software Experience:  Technologies: PowerApps, Power BI, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Exchange, Intune, Azure, PowerShell Programming/Scripting Languages: C#, ASP.Net MVC, Entity Framework, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS Platforms: Windows, Linux Preferred Certifications: Developing business applications with PowerApps and Flow

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities As a Software Automation Engineers, you will think creatively and break the code to provide better experience to our customers. column2: Role & responsibilities     This role will sit within the RPA Centre of Excellence (CoE) of Strategy, Planning and  Transformation function. Specialists and developers deliver Automation projects across the  entire Three organisation. As a Developer you are responsible for development, implementation, and support of RPA projects. You will also be responsible for in life support of any automations delivered by the area and  ensuring best in class user experience for our customers. What else it involves You will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing automation solutions to  best practice. You will work closely with the CoE team and the project owners to review and  refine proposed solutions. Development Task pool: You are required to manage your individual task pool in Jira and  ensure all requestors/stakeholders are updated in a timely fashion. Documentation: You will be required to ensure that all new development or change requests  are correctly documented in line with current best practice in an SDD. Deployments: Code deployments to the production environment to follow business Change  Management process including planning, building, version control and co-ordinating with Bot  Controllers. Maintenance: Maintain RPA solutions through their entire lifespan from development to end[1]of-life. Incident Management: Daily review of a level 3 ticket pool. Working with Bot Controllers and  Managed Services Providers to ensure all incidents are resolved within SLA. Problem solve issues that arise in the day-to-day running of process automations. Estimating Effort: For all development requests into the area there is a requirement to  complete a pragmatic estimate on efforts required. Quality & Testing: All code that is deployed to production needs to be quality checked, tested, and validated before release to production. You will be required to support UAT & ST. Alerting: All automations are to have stringent failover and alerts process to ensure least  possible customer impact. The Skills we are looking for  Must-have  A minimum of 2 years experience in RPA development role  Experience with RPA and OCR technologies (UiPath is desirable)  Adaptable and responds positively to changing business issues.  Experience using GIT version control.  Ability to analyse and understand complex business processes.   Experienced in object-oriented programming and relational database design and  querying concepts  Experience with .NET (C#, VB), VBA, HTML and SQL are desired  You will need to demonstrate strong competence with MS Excel and Jira.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills,  Experience working in an Agile Development Environment.  Great attitude that enjoys working in a team environment.  Ability to manage time and prioritise tasks.  Strong customer focus and obsession with quality.  Ability to effectively communicate with team members and customers.  Experience with the AWS cloud development stack

column2: Role & responsibilities   :    ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Practitioner in Robotic Process Automation tools (BluePrism), to translate business needs into RPA solutions and automations Conceptualizing/Designing RPA process solutions in accordance with standard RPA design principles and conventions (Robotic Operating Model) and prescribed RPA architecture. Configuring new RPA processes and using core workflow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand. Prepare required solution, process and procedural specification documents, test plans, end user training material, configuration documents and production solution support documentation Supporting existing processes and implementing change requirements as part of a structured change control process. Problem solving issues (configuration, integration and security) that arise in day-to-day running of RPA processes and providing timely responses and solutions as required. Working within project planning constraints, communicating any identified project risks and issues to the delivery/project manager accordingly and providing inputs to the change control process. Creating, documenting, and executing test procedures and scenarios for the pre-UAT phases. Supporting the operational teams during the UAT and rollout phases. Actively participate in Agile Scrum Ceremonies (e.g., Sprint Planning, Daily Stand-Up, Sprint Reviews, Sprint Retrospectives). Speak and write with ease, clarity and impact, using a communication style appropriate to the subject matter and audience. Investigate problem situations or issues to get relevant information; adept at asking probing questions to successfully obtain quality information. Maintain and support RPA application infrastructure (application, configuration and integration) Support ASTs yearly Disaster Recovery, Business Continuity and other enterprise events to ensure RPA platform availability. POSITION REQUIREMENTS  Bachelors Degree or 5 years of equivalent work experience. 5+ years of experience building RPA using Blue Prism Ability to illustrate and understand business processes and workflows - Experience using Excel, Visio and other reporting tools Clear understanding of how KPIs translate into SLAs for measuring process performance Blue Prism Certified Developer Accreditation Experience working in an fast-paced, deadline driven Agile environment Prior knowledge of process mapping and process re-design Experience working within a collaborative team structure to achieve business results with specific focus on the customer experience. Knowledge and experience running facilitated working sessions with identified deliverables. Solid end user computing skills, for example intermediate spreadsheet user or similar. Any deeper technological experience such as coding or databases is advantageous but not required An understanding of formal change control procedures and disciplines. Good collaboration skills, applied successfully within teams as well as across other areas. Flexibility and willingness to work simultaneously on a wide range of tasks and projects and ability to prioritize Perks and benefits  :   Being a permanent member of the team at EQ you will be rewarded by our company benefits, these are just a few of what is on offer: 3 days of additional leaves on & above statutory requirement along with 2 days of voluntary leaves to pursue the CSR initiatives   Business related certification expense reimbursement Comprehensive Medical Assurance coverage for dependents & Parents Cab transport for staff working in UK & US shift Accidental & Life cover 3 times of concerned CTC

column2: Automation Analyst- Software Engineer is expected to plan, develop script and manage Comparative Testing and ensuring data quality across dimensions like Accuracy, Completeness, Consistency, Uniqueness, Timeliness, Validity, Currency, Conformity, Integrity, and Precision, the skillset encompasses a broad range of technical proficiencies, analytical capabilities, and specialized knowledge areas. This comprehensive skillset is crucial for addressing the multifaceted challenges of maintaining high-quality data in automated processes.         Technical Skills:         RPA Platform Expertise: Proficient in leading RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere) with the ability to design, develop, and implement RPA solutions.         Database Management: Proficiency in SQL and experience with database technologies for managing, querying, and manipulating data. Understanding of NoSQL databases can also be beneficial for handling unstructured data.         Data Quality Tools: Familiarity with specialized data quality tools for data profiling, cleansing, and validation. Knowledge of ETL tools and processes for data integration and transformation.         APIs and Integration Techniques: Skills in integrating RPA solutions with various data sources and third-party applications through RESTful APIs, web services (SOAP, REST), and other integration methods.         Analytical Skills:         Data Analysis: Ability to analyze and interpret data, identifying issues related to accuracy, completeness, consistency, etc., and applying statistical methods to validate findings.         Quality Assurance Methods: Deep understanding of QA best practices, testing methodologies, and frameworks to ensure the reliability and validity of data within RPA processes.         Data Quality Dimensions Focus:         Accuracy Precision: Ensure data accuracy and precision through validation checks, error detection mechanisms, and comparative testing against known standards or benchmarks.         Completeness: Ability to identify missing or incomplete data and implement processes to ensure data completeness.         Consistency Conformity: Skills in ensuring data consistency across systems and conformity to predefined formats and standards.         Uniqueness Integrity: Techniques to identify and eliminate duplicate data entries, ensuring data uniqueness and integrity, especially in databases and data lakes.         Timeliness Currency: Ensure data is up-to-date and relevant, implementing checks for data timeliness and currency, especially in time-sensitive applications.         Validity Conformity: Proficiency in applying rules and criteria to validate data inputs and ensure they conform to specific schemas, formats, or standards.
column11: Data analysis, Manager Quality Assurance, RDBMS, MIS, Machine learning, Data quality, Troubleshooting, SQL, Python

column2: Capgemini is seeking an Automation Engineer with a background in the Automotive or Embedded Software domain to join our team, responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust test automation frameworks. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of embedded systems and software development, coupled with expertise in automation tools and methodologies.  You are also requested to send your updated resume to vishakha.vishakha@capgemini.com to expedite the processing of your application.  Responsibilities:; Design, develop, and maintain robust test automation frameworks tailored for the Automotive or Embedded Software domain to ensure the delivery of high-quality software products. Develop or possess working knowledge of embedded firmware and software solutions specific to Automotive or Embedded Systems, focusing on optimal performance and resource utilization. Utilize programming languages such as C/C++, Python, or assembly language to implement embedded firmware and software solutions for Automotive or Embedded Systems applications. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and deploy scalable automation solutions using UiPath platform. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into RPA workflows. Implement and optimize automation processes following best practices and industry standards. Lead and mentor junior team members, providing guidance and support in RPA development. Perform thorough testing (SDD, TDD, PDD) to ensure the quality and reliability of automation solutions. Maintain and enhance existing RPA workflows, addressing any issues or enhancements as required. Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate RPA solutions into existing systems and processes. Provide technical expertise and support to troubleshoot and resolve automation-related issues. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in RPA development using UiPath. Proficiency in implementing and customizing RE Framework for automation projects. Extensive knowledge of UiPath Orchestrator for managing and monitoring automation processes. Strong understanding of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies such as SDD, TDD, and PDD. Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex business processes and design efficient automation solutions. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Proven leadership capabilities, with experience in leading and mentoring junior team members. Immediate availability to join and flexibility to work in a hybrid mode (onsite and remote). If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for automation and possess the required skills and experience, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to our innovative projects and grow professionally in a dynamic environment.
column11: Orchestrator, Uipath, Re Framework, Orchestration, Exception Handling, Robotic Process Automation

column1: Application / Recipe Engineer  -  PASX MES - Bangalore
column2: Greetings, We are looking for a Application / Recipe Engineer  -   PASX MES  for Global Pharma company based at Bangalore.  Shall be bachelors degree and above (B.Tech/B.Pharma/ Any Science Degree) and having 8+years of experience in  pharma domain (API, OSD & Injectable).   Should have expertise in implementation of PASX MES end to end Solution with integration   Should have basic knowledge on the integration of application with external systems like SAP, DCS, L2 Layer, Weigh  scales, LIMS and other third-party equipments.   Should have good process knowledge (API/Injectable/Formulation) to understand and map the respective process in the  application.   Should be able to handle Configuration of Application, Master Data Creation, Master Batch Records, ESPs, GMBR, PVL,  PMBR, WMS related activities in PAS-X and troubleshooting of applications.   Coordinating with plant team to identify CPPs to be collected for Interface (L2/DCS System to MES) and documentation  for recipe design.   Mock execution of MBR, Review & Release of executed eBR   Basic understanding of State diagram management, Libraries Creation in PAS|X, Characteristics (CX) Administration,  Creation and Modification of BOM & Recipe in ERP   Trouble shooting & Root cause identification of MES related activities during Execution.   Should have good knowledge on the rights management process and user management in Application.   Should be able to create the client profiles, scale profiles, terminals, printer assignment.   Shall be responsible to understand, preparation, review and execution of protocol, test scripts & reports w.r.t CSV  documentation as applicable.   Responsible for System related procedures creations, documentation & training to end users.  Should be well versed in Handling of QMS such as Change Control, Deviation, CAPA and its timely closure.   Shall have excellent written, verbal communication skill & Soft skills in MS office-word, excel and ppt   Shall be responsible to follow HSE, cGMP and other relevant regulations of Pharma/Biotech  Interested Candidate Please share your cv with uma@bvrpc.com

column2: Position Title: Automation Developer Duration:  12+ Months Location:  Remote Work Timings:  6:30 PM - 3:30 AM (IST) Overview: We are seeking a skilled Automation Developer with a Certified Automation Anywhere background to join our client's team. The ideal candidate will possess a minimum of 6+ years of IT experience, with at least two years specializing in RPA software, particularly Automation Anywhere. Experience in control room activities, integration of RPA with external applications via APIs, and proficiency in technical documentation are highly valued. Job Description: Design and Development:  Collaborate in the design, construction, and configuration of applications using automation tools, ensuring alignment with business process requirements. Technical Consultation:  Work closely with operational and technical teams to communicate design decisions' implications and ensure comprehensive Technical Design Documents (TDD) are created. Opportunity Assessment:  Evaluate potential automation opportunities from a technical standpoint, contributing insights and recommendations. Complex Automation:  Create sophisticated automation solutions to fulfill intricate business process and application needs, employing best practices and standards. Testing and Quality Assurance:  Conduct thorough unit and integration testing to verify that RPA solutions meet functional specifications and uphold quality benchmarks. Code Reviews and Standards:  Participate in code reviews, fostering collaboration and adherence to coding standards and best practices. Documentation:  Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for RPA solutions, including technical specifications, to ensure clarity and facilitate future maintenance. Performance Reporting:  Generate regular reports on the performance of RPA initiatives, offering insights and suggesting enhancements for optimization. Additional Responsibilities:  Undertake other duties as assigned, contributing to the overall success and efficiency of automation initiatives. If you possess the requisite expertise and are enthusiastic about leveraging automation to drive efficiency and innovation in the healthcare sector, we encourage you to apply. Join us in shaping the future of healthcare automation and making a meaningful impact on patient care.

column2: Automation Analyst- Software Engineer is expected to plan, develop script and manage Comparative Testing and ensuring data quality across dimensions like Accuracy, Completeness, Consistency, Uniqueness, Timeliness, Validity, Currency, Conformity, Integrity, and Precision, the skillset encompasses a broad range of technical proficiencies, analytical capabilities, and specialized knowledge areas. This comprehensive skillset is crucial for addressing the multifaceted challenges of maintaining high-quality data in automated processes.         Technical Skills:         RPA Platform Expertise: Proficient in leading RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere) with the ability to design, develop, and implement RPA solutions.         Database Management: Proficiency in SQL and experience with database technologies for managing, querying, and manipulating data. Understanding of NoSQL databases can also be beneficial for handling unstructured data.         Data Quality Tools: Familiarity with specialized data quality tools for data profiling, cleansing, and validation. Knowledge of ETL tools and processes for data integration and transformation.         APIs and Integration Techniques: Skills in integrating RPA solutions with various data sources and third-party applications through RESTful APIs, web services (SOAP, REST), and other integration methods.         Analytical Skills:         Data Analysis: Ability to analyze and interpret data, identifying issues related to accuracy, completeness, consistency, etc., and applying statistical methods to validate findings.         Quality Assurance Methods: Deep understanding of QA best practices, testing methodologies, and frameworks to ensure the reliability and validity of data within RPA processes.         Data Quality Dimensions Focus:         Accuracy Precision: Ensure data accuracy and precision through validation checks, error detection mechanisms, and comparative testing against known standards or benchmarks.         Completeness: Ability to identify missing or incomplete data and implement processes to ensure data completeness.         Consistency Conformity: Skills in ensuring data consistency across systems and conformity to predefined formats and standards.         Uniqueness Integrity: Techniques to identify and eliminate duplicate data entries, ensuring data uniqueness and integrity, especially in databases and data lakes.         Timeliness Currency: Ensure data is up-to-date and relevant, implementing checks for data timeliness and currency, especially in time-sensitive applications.         Validity Conformity: Proficiency in applying rules and criteria to validate data inputs and ensure they conform to specific schemas, formats, or standards.
column11: Data analysis, Manager Quality Assurance, RDBMS, MIS, Machine learning, Data quality, Troubleshooting, SQL, Python

column2: Role: Software Engineer 2   Location: Bangalore, India ACCOUNTABILITIES:  Designs, codes, tests, debugs and documents software according to our systems quality standards, policies and procedures.  Analyzes business needs and creates software solutions.  Responsible for preparing design documentation. Prepares test data for unit, string and parallel testing.  Evaluates and recommends software and hardware solutions to meet user needs.  Resolves customer issues with software solutions and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.  Works with business and development teams to clarify requirements to ensure testability.  Drafts, revises, and maintains test plans, test cases, and automated test scripts.  Executes test procedures according to software requirements specifications Logs defects and makes recommendations to address defects.  Retests software corrections to ensure problems are resolved.  Documents evolution of testing procedures for future replication. May conduct performance and scalability testing.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Prioritizes own work regarding the development, coding, testing and debugging of new software or enhancements to existing software.  Provides resolutions to an assortment of problems of moderately complex scope.  Responsible for the gathering of requirements, analysis, design and implementation of high-quality code for highly complex components in a given product with a focus on software installation solutions.  Responsible for the development and implementation of customized web applications.  Assists in establishing group priorities relative to basic or very specific business needs.  Performs estimation efforts on projects.  Conducts a range of quality-control tests and analysis to ensure that software meets or exceeds specified standards and end-user requirements.   Logs defects and identifies course of action. Detailed Job Description: BIOS Automation Engineer As a BIOS Automation Engineer, responsible for the design and development activities associated with methods for validating hardware/software systems, and broader solutions. Prepares test and diagnostic programs, designs test fixtures and test tools, and completes validation specifications and procedures for new and changes to existing products.  Role Responsibilities:  Responsible for automating UEFI FW Features. Engineer is responsible for the set-up, maintenance and ongoing development of continuous build/ integration infrastructure for BIOS. Support full automation of CI/ Testing. Your responsibilities may include but not be limited to: Understand feature requirements, architecture and design UEFI FW, UEFI FW code debugging UEFI FW testing with SW platform components, like CPU, PCH, FW, OS etc. Participates in the software development lifecycle, which includes research, new development, modification, security, correction of errors, reuse, re-engineering and maintenance of software products Responsible for the delivery of products within budget, schedule and quality guidelines. Manages or utilizes software that is built and implemented as a product, using best-in-class development process/lifecycle management (ex: Agile, Waterfall). Creates technical documentation of software products/solutions. Assists with the validation and review of end user and technical end user documentation. Develops and implements plans and tests for product quality or performance assurance. Be familiar with Window security features Technical understanding of common security vulnerabilities and risks, as well as countermeasures and compensating controls.  Skillset:  UEFI, Python, C, C++ Good understanding of Quality Control and Test Automation in Agile-based Continuous Integration environments

column2: Role & responsibilities   1 . Solution Customization: Customize and configure Dynamics 365 applications to meet the unique requirements of the organization, including creating entities, fields, forms, views, workflows, and business rules.  2. Plugin Development: Develop custom plugins, custom workflow activities, and integrations to extend the functionality of Dynamics 365 and integrate it with other systems.  3. Web Resource Development: Create and manage web resources such as HTML, JavaScript, and CSS files for use in Dynamics 365 forms and pages.  4. Data Integration: Design and implement data integration solutions using tools like Data Import Wizard, Data Export Service, and Azure Integration Services.  5. Report Development: Build custom reports and dashboards using Power BI or SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) to provide actionable insights to stakeholders.  6. Power Platform: Experience with Power Platform- e.g., Power Automate, Power Apps, Power BI etc.  7. Testing and Debugging: Conduct thorough testing and debugging of customizations and integrations to ensure they meet quality and performance standards.  8. Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of customizations, configurations, and processes for future reference and compliance.  9. User Training: Provide training and support to end-users and stakeholders to ensure effective adoption and utilization of Dynamics 365 solutions.  10. Security Configuration: Implement security models and roles to control access to data and functionality within Dynamics 365.  11. Upgrades and Maintenance: Stay up to date with the latest Dynamics 365 updates and perform necessary upgrades and maintenance tasks.  12. Qualifications:   Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).   Proven experience in customizing and configuring Dynamics 365 applications, including Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement and Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations.   Proficiency in programming languages such as C#, JavaScript, and TypeScript.   Familiarity with Azure services and cloud-based solutions.   Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.   Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.   Relevant Microsoft certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Customization and Configuration) are a plus. column2: Skill required:Tech for Operations - Microsoft Robotic Process Automation  Designation:Analyst  Qualifications:BE/Any Graduation  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be part of the Technology for Operations team that acts as a trusted advisor and partner to Accenture Operations. The team provides innovative and secure technologies to help clients build an intelligent operating model, driving exceptional results. We work closely with the sales, offering and delivery teams to identify and build innovative solutions. The Tech For Operations (TFO) team provides innovative and secure technologies to help clients build an intelligent operating model, driving exceptional results. Works closely with the sales, offering and delivery teams to identify and build innovative solutions. Major sub deals include AHO(Application Hosting Operations), ISMT (Infrastructure Management), Intelligent Automation The position is on automating business processes using Robotic Process Automation Tools Like BluePrism, Automation Anywhere, etc. This role includes writing code in C#, VB.NET, .NET to provide automation. Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Ability to develop and/or follow a project plan knowing the importance of setting and meeting milestone dates. Co-develop successive releases of controls software products in coordination with product champions. This includes the performance of complex design, maintenance, enhancement, testing, implementation, and support of these products. Experience in the design and development of controls based on physical layouts is expected. Software must be well structured, easy to understand and well documented. Develop software tools for the rapid deployment of controls software products for testing and applications environments. Ability to baseline existing systems, make needed improvements to stabilize/upgrade existing systems. This will require the ability to complete a complex review of requirements and limitations to determine that the systems perform optimally. Complete the quality process through the execution of module, subsystem, and system test procedures  including customer site commissioning when required. Ability to produce all documentation required as part of the development process including detailed design specifications, test documents and descriptions of operation. Complete estimates for modules under development and especially own work. Perform review of complex standards specifications and other documentation to determine engineering requirements. Perform presentations of complex technical findings and developments. Contribute to the development and maintenance of controls software standards. Train regional product champions in order to efficiently deploy the developed software products. 5% to 15% travel will be required Desired Candidate Profile   The CTO Global Controls Software Organization within responsible for delivering standard software and software controls products to support a wide range of conveyor and sortation solutions, warehouse automation, and distribution operations. As a Controls Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing standard controls software for PLC or other real time controller platforms. As part of a team within the controls software development organization, you will be responsible for delivering this software for our global customers, in partnership with our product management, application engineering and customer service groups. You must have a passion for excellence, the drive to complete tasks within the required time frame, the ability to work in a team environment and the technical skill to produce software of a high standard. Work, Health, Safety & Environment (WHS&E) Responsibilities Take care of your own health and safety as well as that of others including the implementation of risk control measures to prevent injuries or illnesses. Prevent pollution to the environment. Co-operate with policies, procedures and instructions including timely reporting of hazards, incidents and injuries via reporting process. Other responsibilities as outlined in WHS&E system documentation.   Other Responsibilities :- Comply with relevant statutory and legal requirements as required. Commit to and cooperate with quality management systems and processes. Key Relationships Other Software Development Groups. Development Project Management and Quality Assurance. Application Engineering. Mechatronics R&D. Product Management. Customer Service. Knowledge/Experience & Competence Req A minimum of 3 years PLC programming experience including current, hands-on experience with material handling / intralogistics systems (conveyor, stacker cranes, or pallet conveying systems). column2: Greetings form Sopra Steria!   We are seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented Business Analyst cum RPA Developer to join our team. In this role, you will play a dual role, leveraging your business acumen and technical skills to automate core financial processes (F&A) using either UiPath or Power Automate. You will bridge the gap between business users and developers, ensuring that RPA solutions effectively address F&A needs across Procure-to-Pay (P2P), Order-to-Cash (O2C), Record-to-Report (R2R), and Supply Chain Management (SCM) processes. Responsibilities: Business Analysis: Collaborate with F&A stakeholders to understand current processes, identify automation opportunities, and document process flows. Analyze business requirements and translate them into technical specifications for RPA development. Conduct gap analysis to assess the feasibility of automation for various F&A tasks. Identify solutions to productize our digital offerings in the F&A space by leveraging RPA and other digital technologies Lead high priority or super critical RPA projects/assessments/consulting assignments in the F&A space RPA Development: Dive standard best practices across RPA implementations in the F&A space within the organization Develop, test, and deploy RPA solutions using UiPath or Power Automate to automate F&A processes. Configure robots to interact with existing F&A systems and applications. Ensure the accuracy, efficiency, and reliability of automated processes. Support and Maintenance: Provide ongoing support and maintenance for deployed RPA solutions. Troubleshoot issues and identify areas for improvement in RPA processes. Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in RPA technologies and best practices. Identifying technical infrastructure requirements for UIPath. Total Experience Expected: 08-10 years   Skills and Qualification Master's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field. 10+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or similar role. 5+ years of experience developing RPA solutions using UiPath or Power Automate (preferred). Strong understanding of F&A processes, including P2P, O2C, R2R, and SCM. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively manage relationships with stakeholders at all levels. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines Certified Power Platform & UI Path Developer is preferred Interested candidates can share their profile @ yogendra.bisht@soprasteria.com
